courses.description: This course is designed to develop basic knowledgebase in infectious diseases in the society, in contexts of causation, impacts, diagnosis and epidemiology.
courses.enrollment_requirement: For TPg students in Master of Public Health / Postgraduate Diploma in Public Health

Students are expected to

2) Know the differences between viruses, bacteria, fungi, and parasites
3) Understand how the human immune system protects against infection

courses.description: Students would be introduced to the principles and practice of infection control in three settings–hospital and clinic, laboratory and the community, through a series of lectures tailored to the needs of public health professionals. The emphasis would be on the development of a systematic approach to infection control practice.

courses.learning_outcomes:
Student should be able to:
1. update on the principles of infection control in health care setting, laboratory and community
2. familiarize with system development in infection control practice

| L3: (I) Immunity and immunization and (II) Vaccination of health care workers |

| Root Cause Analysis |

meetings.instructor:
Dr. WONG Kwan Kit, 
Professor LEE Shui Shan, 
Professor WONG Ngai Sze

courses.description:
"Geographical information system (GIS), integrating cartography, statistical analysis, and database technology, has been widely applied in the study of public health, for example, disease surveillance, risk assessment, and decision making for public health practices. This course aims to offer a general introduction to GIS, including basic concepts, methodologies, and applications of GIS in public health issues.

No special prerequisite for this course. Class size can NOT be larger than 40."
courses.enrollment_requirement: For TPg students in Master of Public Health / Postgraduate Diploma in Public Health
courses.course_syllabus:
| **Introduction** 1. What is geographical information system (GIS); 2. GIS application in public health; 3. Project arrangement |
| --- |
| **Understanding spatial data for public health and mapping health information** 1. Characteristics and examples of spatial data; 2. Where to access spatial data? *3. Coordinate systems, projections, and transformation;* |
| **Lab tutorial 1** 1. Getting QGIS started; 2. Importing spatial data to QGIS; 3. Mapping health information in QGIS |
| **Locating health information** 1. Geocoding; 2. Generating spatial data in QGIS; 3. Mapping and cartography |
| **Spatial analysis** 1. Data exploration: query 2. Overlay operation 3. Neighbourhood operation 4. Network analysis |
| **Lab tutorial 2** 1. Spatial data editing in QGIS; 2. Performing spatial analyses; 3. Results interpretation |
| **Starting a GIS project** 1. Key things to consider for setting up a GIS project; 2. Introduction to GIS Software available and online resources; 3. More about applications 4. Q&A |
courses.required_readings: Ellen Cromley & Sara McLafferty. (2011). *GIS and Public Health* (2nd ed.). New York; London: Guilford Press.
courses.recommended_readings:
| Longley, P. (2011). *Geographic information systems & science* (3rd ed.). Hoboken, NJ: Wiley. |
| --- |

courses.subject: INFD
courses.title: Introduction of Bioinformatics
courses.description: This course intends to provide an overview of the bioinformatics analyses for health management and epidemiological studies. Content of this course includes to examine the current knowledge and strategy for managing information of patient- and pathogen-specific covariates and genetic information to understand disease progression or host-pathogen interaction. Key issues in i) Genetic Association Studies, ii) Network Analysis, iii) Deep Sequencing Applications and iv) Phylogenetic Analysis will be addressed in this course.
courses.enrollment_requirement: For TPg students under School of Public Health
courses.learning_outcomes:
Student should be able to:
1. Gain knowledge related to modern molecular and computation tools and resources for studying health risk and epidemiology
2. Examine predicting factors associated with human health outcomes
3. Participate effectively in multi-disciplinary collaboration in disease based program planning and evaluation activities related to health responses and infectious disease control.
courses.course_syllabus:
- Genetic Association Studies
- Network Analysis
- Deep Sequencing Applications
- Phylogenetic Analysis
